reference.shortdesc: Use the svg-container element to store content that contributes to a scalable vector graphic (SVG). Such content includes SVG elements, references to SVG elements that are stored in separate, non-DITA documents, data, or data-about elements.

section.title: Usage Information
section.p: The SVG markup must have a root element of svg with the SVG namespace: "http://www.w3.org/2000/svg".

section.title: Inheritance
section.p: The svg-container element is specialized from foreign. It is defined in the svg-domain module.

SVG inline:
example.p: In the following code sample, the svgref element uses the keyref attribute to address SVG markup that is stored in a separate, non-DITA document:<fig> <title>Figure with SVG Container</title> <svg-container> <svgref keyref="svg-fragment-01"/> </svg-container> </fig>
The key "svg-fragment-01" in the above code is declared in the following way:<map> ... <keydef keys="svg-fragment-01" href="media/svg/svg-library.xml#frag-0001" format="svg" /> ... </map>
